summary: Build an Android image gallery app for Android TV, phones, and tablets (Android 10+), featuring slideshow, navigation, zoom controls, and additional viewing options.

existing_features.title: Implement an image gallery application UI that works well on Android TV browsers and on Android phones/tablets (Android 10+), with a responsive layout that supports both 10-foot (TV) viewing and touch/handheld use.

Provide a gallery data flow that lets users populate the gallery by adding images via direct URL and by uploading image files (JPG/PNG/WebP) from the browser, then display them as thumbnails in a grid view.
Implement a full-screen image viewer with Next/Previous navigation controls and remote-friendly keyboard support (D-pad/arrow keys, Enter/OK, Back/Escape).
Add slideshow mode with configurable interval and controls to Play/Pause; slideshow must advance through images and integrate with Next/Previous (manual navigation should reset/continue logically).
Implement zoom controls (Zoom In, Zoom Out, Reset) in the viewer with smooth scaling and panning/dragging when zoomed; support TV remote and touch/mouse interactions.
Add “more options” menu in the viewer with at least: Fit to Screen / Actual Size toggle, Rotate Left/Right (90°), and optional image info (dimensions, source type, createdAt).
Ensure TV-friendly accessibility and focus management: all interactive elements must be reachable by keyboard navigation, with visible focus states and sensible tab order.
Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, component style) suitable for a living-room gallery experience; avoid blue/purple as dominant colors.
Add generated static assets (logo and a subtle background texture) and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated within the app UI (e.g., header branding and optional background).

new_feature_requests.summary: Android image gallery app targeting Android TV with slideshow support
Image navigation controls: next/previous during viewing and slideshow
Zoom controls: zoom in / zoom out for images
Support Android phone and tablet form factors in addition to Android TV
Add additional image viewing options (unspecified "more options")
Create Motoko backend endpoints to store and retrieve gallery items, supporting both URL-based images and uploaded image blobs, and expose a stable API used by the React app (React Query).

architectural_notes: Target platforms: Android TV + Android phone/tablet; minimum Android version 10 (API 29).
